definition: to upset the apple cart/to disrupt things
to disturb/to annoy/to mix/to stir
narrow
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: Just when I was almost finished, Henry came along and toppled the house of cards.
sentences.chinese: 工作即将完成之际，亨利进来搅局，让我全功尽弃。

definition: to loot a burning house/to profit from sb's misfortune (idiom)
to disrupt/to throw into disorder
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
lit. Cheng Yaojin ambushes the enemy (saying)/fig. sb shows up unexpectedly and disrupts the plan/sb whose presence is regarded as irksome
pinyin: ban4 lu4 sha1 chu1 ge4 Cheng2 Yao3 jin1

definition: see 半路殺出個程咬金|半路杀出个程咬金[ban4 lu4 sha1 chu1 ge4 Cheng2 Yao3 jin1]

definition: to take advantage of sb's misfortune/to loot
to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to incite disharmony/to instigate
sit on the mountain and watch the tigers fight/watch in safety whilst others fight then reap the rewards when both sides are exhausted (idiom)
two tigers fighting (idiom); fierce contest between evenly matched adversaries
to throw stones at sb who fell down a well (idiom); to hit a person who is down
to use the current topic to put over one's own ideas/to use sth as a pretext to make a fuss
formidable opponent
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
to covet/to long for/to lust after
the quick-footed climb up first (idiom)/the early bird catches the worm/first come, first served
